summary: William D. Campbell was an FBI Special Agent. The documents indicate his involvement in FBI investigations, specifically those related to Martin Luther King Jr. and electronic surveillance activities. He was interviewed by the Senate Select Committee (SSC) regarding these investigations. The documents also mention FBI responses to requests from the U.S. Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC) for materials related to Martin Luther King, Jr., and the Southern Christian Leadership Conference, suggesting Campbell may have been involved in providing information or materials to the committee.
significance: Based on the provided documents, William D. Campbell's significance in the JFK context is indirect. The documents focus on his involvement in FBI investigations related to Martin Luther King Jr. and electronic surveillance, as well as his interactions with the Senate Select Committee. There is no direct mention of the JFK assassination in relation to him in these documents.
